contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "eyes" represents the person who looks. Alternate translation: "I looked up" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
The word "eyes" represents the person who looks. Alternate translation: "I looked up" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
Here the word "flesh" represents all humanity. Alternate translation: "all people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
Here the word "hands" represents Zerubbabel. Alternate translation: "Zerubbabel has laid ... he will bring it to completion" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: The hands of Zerubbabel have laid ... his hands will bring it to completion

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "eyes" represents the person who looks. Alternate translation: "looked up" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
The word "eyes" represents the person who looks. Alternate translation: "Look up" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
Here the word "eyes" represents the person who sees. Alternate translation: "I looked up" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
Here the word "eyes" represents the person who sees. Alternate translation: "looked up" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
Here the bow represents all weapons used in warfare. Alternate translation: "all weapons of war will be destroyed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: the bow will be cut off from battle

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "hearts" refers to the whole person. They will have the same joy as a person who is enjoying drinking wine. Alternate translation: "and they will be very happy" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: their hearts will rejoice as with wine

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "feet" represents Yahweh. Alternate translation: "he will stand on the Mount of Olives" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: his feet will stand on the Mount of Olives
